page.title: 09TYNEMOUTH AND THE SEA
page.content: Tynemouth and North Shields have had a long association with the sea and all that it involves. Before the two piers were built at the entrance to the River Tyne, it was a commom sight to see ships aground on the rocks at the foot of the cliffs, so it was not surprising to learn that the first lifeboat was invented by an engineer from North Shields - William Wouldhave. Lifeboats soon became a common sight around the coasts but in certain situations they cannot get close enough to the foot of steep cliffs, and with this in mind the Tynemouth Volunteer Life Brigade was formed, operating from the Watch House on the cliff top. From then Tynemouth became a centre for marine rescue and a brand new communications centre has been built in the grounds of the Priory.
